Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel Antonio, the new owner, went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable! The rooms are very nice, the rates were reasonable, the location is great (although it was about an 8 euro taxi ride to the train station). Free internet in the lobby, a decent breakfast area, and an amazingly friendly staff. We had a triple, which was nice because it was like a 2-bedroom apartment with a little kitchenette. We couldn't say enough nice things about this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Randy71

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel! We booked Hotel Dante through Venere.com. What a find! It is located in a safe, quiet alley right behind the beautiful church of Santa Croce (where Galileo, Machiavelli, Rossini and other notables were buried). At night the little square in front of the church is filled with locals as well as tourists just hanging out, enjoying the cool air. The hotel is an easy stroll (approx. 10 mins.) to the Piazza della Signoria, Ponte Vecchio, the Duomo, etc., down narrow streets lined with shops. There's a tiny supermarket just down the street from the hotel, and the post office and a Standa supermarket are about 10-15 minutes away.The four of us were given two adjoining double rooms on the 3rd floor sharing a hallway behind a lockable door. One of the rooms even has a kitchenette and laundry area. The rooms are bright and airy. Furnishings are modest but new--quite homelike in feel. Housekeeping is immaculate.Unusual for hotels of this kind, located in old buildings, Hotel Dante has an elevator!The included breakfast is substantial--you can have your fill of rolls and croissants, cereal and milk and yogurt. You eat in a tiny courtyard under market umbrellas. The owners are friendly and helpful. There's free internet access on a computer set aside for guests. All this for very, very reasonable rates. We'll definitely stay here again on our next visit to Florence.
Reviews.Author: saulwong

Reviews.Content: Great hotel - far from railway and busstation Located close to S. Croce, a beautiful church. The rooms were dark and small. The staff were great! Not very of a wow breakfast. Just juice, croissants, baguettes and jam. Far from the railway station and just 5 min walk to Piazza Signora. All in all a chramful, nice hotel.
Reviews.Author: Qvang

Reviews.Content: Just OK Hotel Dante, Florence, Italy Our family of four (two adult children) experience with Hotel Dante was, there were several ants on the kitchen table when we arrived, killed them and put all of the food we had in our little refrigerator and never saw any more. The room my husband and I slept in was only large enough to fit a sofa bed type of mattress, our suitcases didn't fit in the room and our feet were higher than our heads! We allowed our kids to sleep in the nice room with two twin beds, nice, big closets. The kid's room was really pretty nice! The bathroom looked like it had recently been redone, it was nice, but you couldn't turn around in it. You stepped out of the shower and you were sitting on the toilet. The management was VERY nice though. The night management man didn't speak one work of English, so that was a bit of a problem. The cup of espresso they made fresh for me the first morning I was there was THE best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life. Breakfast was rolls with jam and butter, croissants that weren't very good and one type of cereal, fruit juice. Pretty basic. I guess you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: TweetybirdMissouri

Reviews.Content: Not above average The Hotel Dante is very clean and well-located with okay bathrooms. However, the quadruple room we requested for the children wasn't really fit for 4. The connecting room with an old sofabed was dark and none of the teens ended up stayed there since there was hardly any ventilation in it. They ended up cramped in the double bed. Was also disappointed with staff's recommendation of restaurant - no ambiance whatsoever and pricey for what it was. Maybe better to rely on your guidebook to get around.
Reviews.Author: welltraveledAsia

Reviews.Content: Hated Every Moment This hotel was the most appalling hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were terrible. It felt like being couped up in a cell with really bad 70's furniture. Plus you had to leave your passport and your room key with weird staff every time you went out. When we booked our room it didn't tell us we had a kitchenette. Usually a kitchenette would be a plus, but here it is a nasty surprise. We really felt like prisoners whenever we were in the room. If we had a really good cheap price, I wouldn't complain, but we paid considerably more than average in Florence. The breakfast was awful too. This is really one to give a miss.
Reviews.Author: Gengirl11

Reviews.Content: Real Italian Hotel       The Trevi Fountain. Rome
Reviews.Author: nettynkev

Reviews.Content: Tommaso and his team are excellent . Good price, very central my wife and I were very happy with the service, breakfast and the location is very good. We will go again when we return to Florence We recommend this hotel . We love the Operas and the Arts and of course the people in Italy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Value Stayed here for 4 days in room #106.Raves:  - Spacious. #106 actually has a little kitchen and a sitting room attached. We didn't take advantage of these features much, but it would've been a great addition for a family. - Friendly staff. Everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant and helpful. - Location. A stone's throw from Santa Croce church and a short walk to the Uffizi  Ponte Vecchio. - Breakfast. A decent spread with lots of fresh fruit.Nits: - Small bathroom. Though well-equipped and seemly renovated recently, it was still a bit tight. - Hair dryer. I personally didn't use it, but the darn thing is LOUD and, according to the girlfriend, not very effective. - Elevator. The smallest elevator I've ever seen. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Dante and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good value in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Pt_Fwd

Reviews.Content: Cough Cough...smoke and room perfume I was very excited about this hotel because it had such great reviews. It was unquestionably my worst hotel experience in Italy. It is in a good location right at Santa Croce, and as a bonus there is a cab stand at the Santa Croce Piazza so you don't have to have a cab called for you (you pay for the cab from the moment it is dispatched). It's right around the corner from Vivoli, one of the best gelaterias in Florence. The staff is friendly. Now for the downside: when I opened my room door I was assailed by an overwhelming smell of perfume that was obviously used to cover up the overwhelming smell of smoke. I started choking pretty much from the moment I entered the room. Within half an hour my nose was running and I was sneezing. I asked the man at the desk if there were any non-smoking rooms available, and he acted like he had no idea what I was talking about, which would be understandable...had I not been asking him in Italian! The window opened onto a courtyard, so there was no air circulation to try to get some of the unbearable odors out, but I slept with it open anyway (despite the noise) because the thought of shutting myself into that room with all those allergens made me feel like I was going to suffocate. The bathroom was even worse with perfume and I had to keep the door to it closed at all times. By the end of a shower I was miserable from being closed up in there with steam enhancing the potency of the perfume. The only way I could sleep in there was by taking Benadryl, and during the day taking Actifed (E6.00 at the Farmacia) to try to clear out the allergies. As I was checking out I noticed an air freshener was plugged in, I wish I had seen it before as unplugging it might have given me some relief from the heavy, unbearable perfume. The breakfast was strictly continental, though there was plenty of fruit. For a smoky suffocating room, Hotel Pagnini was cuter, cheaper, and somewhat less smoky with no perfume. If they have non-smoking rooms (doubtful), this would be a good hotel. If you are at all sensitive to smoke or perfume (and I am not even that sensitive to perfume! It was just so heavy!!!), stay far away from this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel Perfect Hotel. Great Location. Great Rooms. Great Hosts. Great Price. Have stayed there twice and will return everytime I'm in Florence.
Reviews.Author: TNTravel

Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great hosts I doubt that you could beat Hotel Dante's value for money anywhere else in Florence. The rooms were spacious enough for me, my wife and our 2 children. They were very clean and only cost us 100 euro per night. It is also only about 15 minutes walk to the Statue of David.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The entire staff becomes your friend. The entire staff of the Hotel Dante becomes your friend. They treat you like family. We enjoyed every minute of our stay there. Thank you Andrea, Gilberto, Enrico, Isabella, Marco, Maria and Giuliana for all your help and kindness. Grazia! John and Marcia Wokosin
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: fantastic this hotel is a discovery that you wanna keep secret.so next time you go back there is a free room or it wil be booked. we paid 98 euros double room with kitchen.no point paying for breakfast... excellent service...i would espect to pay double for the facilities.i will return.just read the comments in the guest book when you get there.
Reviews.Author: warice
